paragraphs.content: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

paragraphs.content: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.

paragraphs.content: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

paragraphs.content: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,
paragraphs.contentHtml: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

paragraphs.content: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

paragraphs.content: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

paragraphs.content: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

paragraphs.content: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

paragraphs.content: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

paragraphs.content: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

paragraphs.content: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

paragraphs.content: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

paragraphs.content: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

paragraphs.content: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

paragraphs.content: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.

paragraphs.content: ¶ It was written to Titus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Cretians, from Nicopolis of Macedonia.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ It was written to Titus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Cretians, from Nicopolis of Macedonia.
